comprehensive_overview: netCDF (network Common Data Form) is a set of software libraries and self-describing, machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and sharing of array-oriented scientific data.
core_features: Supports creation, access, and sharing of array-oriented scientific data
Maintains data in a form that is self-describing and portable
Provides software APIs for C, C++, Fortran, Java, and other programming languages
Supports parallel I/O and data compression
Facilitates data subsetting and hyperslab selection
